item.description:
Compass Course, Instructor John Joseph
Hosted by Bay State Trail Riders Association (BSTRA), DCR and Friends MSSF

The intent of the course is to train people to be able to navigate in the forest with only a map and compass.

Here are the learning topics:

  • Interpreting a map
  • Learning how to determine direction (N,S,E,W) without a compass
  • Learn how to plot a course from “A” to “B” on a map
  • A practical field exercise in compass navigation

There is a lot of reliance on GPS units, however people in the forest should know how to navigate when the batteries die in the GPS or it breaks. The course is not a survival course, but a confidence building course.

The cost of instructional materials, provided by the instructor, is $6.00/person.

Each participant need only bring a compass (of the type shown below) and wear clothes suitable for the outdoors. The total cost (compass and materials) is between $15 & 23. Some participants may want to work as a team and can share a compass, thereby reducing the cost.

The instruction shall take place in the conference center at Myles Standish State Forest and the practical exercise in an area near the fire tower off Bare Hill Road where there is a predefined compass course.

Each person (or two person team) should bring a baseplate compass. The type shown in the first picture (not a lensatic compass shown in the second picture). They can be purchased anywhere from Walmart to REI from $8.00 to $20.00. The less expensive compass will do fine.

Course schedule:
9:00 AM to 10:30 AM Classroom: Map reading and course plotting with compass
11:00 AM to 12:30 PM Field Exercise: Land navigation
The class limit is now open for 18.


Compass Spec’s

  • Baseplate compass Yes
  • Lensatic compass No
